thread.title: North East innovation expert poached to take top job in Scotland

author: Graeme Whitfield
title: North East innovation expert poached to take top job in Scotland
text:
Business North East innovation expert poached to take top job in Scotland North East LEP innovation director Hans Moller will leave his job in October to take a post in Edinburgh Share Han Moller, Innovation Director with the North East Local Enterprise Partnership Share Get business updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The man put in charge of driving innovation among businesses in the North East has been poached to a take on a top job in Scotland. 
Hans Möller, who was innovation director at the North East LEP , has been appointed director of Edinburgh BioQuarter, an organisation in the Scottish capital which brings together life science companies and health services. 
Mr Möller will leave the North East in October. 
He said: “This is a big challenge but one which I’m really looking forward to taking on. The opportunity to move to Edinburgh and to head up a new team at Edinburgh BioQuarter was a big draw for me. 
“I can see lots of opportunities to develop what is already a really attractive proposition and a unique place. When you look at what is already established at the park – the highly-skilled people, the hospital, the world-class research and the life sciences companies then we have great foundations to work from.” 
Mr Möller, who had previously run a science park in his native Sweden before coming to the North East, recently spoke about the need for innovation in the North East economy as it adapts to the challenges of Brexit. Like us on Facebook
